intro: Conopodium olgae, commonly known as the Olgae bladder nut, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, inflated, bladder-like fruits that contain seeds. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or meadow habitats. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. Conopodium olgae is often found in the northern hemisphere, particularly in Europe and parts of Asia.
